newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's Jan to Apr agricultural imports fall.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's Jan to Apr agricultural imports fall.

text.p: The value of South Korea's agricultural product imports in the first four months of 1997 fell 2.5 percent to $3.383 billion from $3.469 billion a year earlier, the agriculture ministry said on Wednesday.
The ministry said the value of livestock product imports rose 1.2 percent to $437 million from $431.8 million a year ago.

Corn imports for the first four months fell 14.9 percent to 2,589,000 tonnes from 3,044,000 tonnes a year ago, while soybean imports rose 23.7 percent to 491,000 tonnes from 397,000 tonnes, the statement said.
The country's wheat imports for the period rose 11.9 percent to 1,010,000 tonnes from 902,000 tonnes, it said.
Beef imports fell 16.5 percent to 58,900 tonnes due to falling domestic beef prices, compared to 70,600 tonnes a year earlier, it said.
Pork imports for the four months surged 178.2 percent to 24,200 tonnes from 8,700 tonnes a year ago, it said.

"The rise in pork imports for the period was mainly due to the arrival difference of pork imports between the two years under the Minimum Market Access quota," said an official with the ministry's livestock and management division.

The official said the 14,620 tonnes of South Korea's pork import quota for this year were arrived till April. But the 23,392 tonnes of last year's import quota had begun to arrive from the end of March in 1996.
